DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response used to determine the numerical distance from the closest point of the lesion to the closest point of the surgical margin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical._The space separating two objects or points.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: The space between two objects or points.

Concepts.definition: The space separating two objects or points.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Updated to associate with Object Class Surgical Margin instead of the post-coordinated terms. Surgical was retired concept.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To One Millimeter And Less Than Five Millimeter

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To One Millimeter And Less Than Five Millimeter
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
